clinical_study.brief_title: Pressure Injury Prevention in the ICU With Multi-Layer Foam Dressings
clinical_study.official_title: A Multi-Centre, Open, Non-controlled, Clinical Investigation to Evaluate the User Friendliness and Wear Time of Multi-layer Foam Dressings With Safetac® for Pressure Injury Prevention in the Intensive Care Unit

brief_summary.textblock: A Multi-Centre, Open, Non-controlled, Clinical Investigation to Evaluate the User Friendliness and Wear Time of Multi-layer Foam Dressings With Safetac® for Pressure Injury Prevention in the Intensive Care Unit

primary_outcome.measure: User Friendliness of both sacrum and heel (left & right) dressings: comfort, conformability, acceptability, the handling at application and ease of inspection of the dressings as well as reapplication
primary_outcome.description: User friendliness judged by site staff, with the following variables; Ability to stay in place Facilitation of inspection of skin Ease of reapplication following skin inspection Conformability to contours of the body Overall impression of dressing

secondary_outcome.description: Maximum length of wear time/stay on ability of dressings in ICU.

other_outcome.description: AE=Adverse Event, SAE= Serious Adverse Event, SADE= Serious Adverse Device Event, DD= Device Defficiency

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patient is at risk for developing a pressure injury to the heels and/or sacrum
- Aged ≥ 18 years
- Patient or his/her legal representative is able to understand and voluntarily sign the informed consent
- Estimated treatment period in ICU for patient at least 4-6 days
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patient has a pressure injury or blistering on sacrum and/or heels
- Patient with known or suspected sensitivity to any of the components of the products being evaluated
- Patient included in other clinical investigations at present or within the last 30 days
